sentence.text: This male was born as part of a monozygotic twin at 39 weeks of age with a weight of 3550 g (75%).
At birth he was noted to have an omphalocele, which was surgically repaired.
During surgery intraabdominal testes were identified.
At 13 months length was 76.5 cm (50%) and OFC 49.5 cm (95%).

He had frontal bossing, a large anterior fontanel, prominent eyes, hypertelorism, a small upturned nose, a triangular mouth, gingival hyperplasia, low-set ears, mesomelic upper limb shortening, short fingers and toes, a small penis and cryptorchidism.
X-rays showed hypoplasia of phalanges and bifid 1st and 2nd fingers.
Abdominal ultrasound and intravenous urography showed left pyeloureteral duplication.
At 14 years of age facial dysmorphisms were less striking and intelligence was normal.
Height was 172.3 (90%) and OFC 59 cm (+3 SD).
Hypertelorism, brachydactyly and mesomelia were present.
At 21 years of age growth remained with the same features (height 188 cm, 90%, weight 70 kg (50%) and OFC 63 cm, (+4SD), but proportionate, and intelligence was normal.
Multiple orthodontic treatments had been performed for dental malalignment.
